1595165517_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
I would say, zeronet is functional only for popular zites.

It's close to impossible for a new zite to get peers. Peers need to be online at the same time, and not hidden by the NAT.

Even worse, the site owner can update the zite only when the peers are online at the time.
Unlike IPFS which actively store the routing information upon publishing.
It's not just about being online most of the time, it's also about not running behind NAT
